description: From Latin ophidia (from Ancient Greek ὄφις (óphis, “snake”))  +‎ -ian.

adjectives.description: ophidian (comparative more ophidian, superlative most ophidian)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to the suborder Serpentes; of, related to, or characteristic of a snake or serpent.
Any species of the suborder Serpentes; a snake or serpent.
